hanzi-su-wiki:
撲

Значения

Бить

Мнемоника

Справа — метла, которой дома наводят красоту 美. Вверху у неё — прутья. Пороть 扌 прутьями от метлы.

Варианты

扑
purpleculture_pinyin:
pū
to throw oneself at; to pounce on; to devote one's energies; to flap; to flutter; to dab; to pat; to bend over
броситься на; наброситься на; посвящать свою энергию; хлопать; трепетать; промокнуть; погладить; наклониться
rtega_mnemonic:
撲撲RS
扑扑		pound, beat, strike, attack
  • hand 扌 beating away the vegetation while going through it 菐
  • hand 扌 of the fortuneteller 卜 beating the skull of an animal
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 扑)
Pictophonetic: 菐 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
撲滅 [ pū miè ]: to eradicate; to extinguish
撲通 [ pū tōng ]: (onom.) sound of object falling into water; plop
撲救 [ pū jiù ]: firefighting; to extinguish a fire and save life and property; to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
撲克 [ pū kè ]: poker (game) (loanword); playing cards
撲鼻 [ pū bí ]: to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 菐 [ pú ] thicket
heisig_chinese_memo: Some squatting yoga poses make you bend your fingers on the ground and look like you are about to pounce on something.
heisig_constituent: slap, finger, fingers, upside down in a row, husband
heisig_story: Fingers . . . upside down in a row . . . husbands.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: slap, strike, hit, beat, tell, speak
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: пощечина, удар, удар, удар, сказать, говори
koohiiStory1: After a row husbands take their wives upsides down over the knee and slap them with their fingers on the bottom (if that doesn´t get me banned…).
koohiiStory2: Here we have badly behaving HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. Each wife approaches her HUSBAND, berates him, gives him a sharp SLAP in the face and, Three-Stooges style, pokes him in the eyes with her FINGERS.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Put your fingers in somebody's business by slapping them! This method also works if someone is getting too involved in your business. Slaps are basically your way of doing business with your fingers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine giving someone a good, hard slap in the face. You're all up in their business now.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: ぼく is one way to say "I" in Japanese, usually used by dudes. But you're going to use it now when you slap this guy. Who's in everybody's business, slapping them? ぼく.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Say that out loud, using ぼく. You're the boss, the boss of slap business.
Ru_Meaning: slap, strike, hit, beat, tell, speak
Ru_Notes:
Внимание: одно из частых употреблений — не по чтению: 相撲 [すもう] сумо
Сравни: 僕 (ボク я).
Ru_Words:
撲るなぐる
  • бить, ударять
    • 相撲すもう
  • сумо́ (вид японской борьбы)
  • борец сумо́
    • warodai
    撲滅ぼくめつ
  • уничтожение, искоренение
    • JR-EDICT
Ru_Radicals: 人 (человек), 并, 扎, 王 (монарх), 羊 (овца)
Ru_trainchinese: pū: (глаг) кидаться к; набрасываться на; посвящать (напр., себя чему-л.); хлопать, похлопывать; (диал.) склоняться над
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the troublesome (菐) hand (扌) slaps
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The cat tries to suprise the wizard and pounce on him around the apartment, but the wizard always manages to use his fingers to put up a shield with his magic wand before the cat reaches him.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand " to the sound of "菐". The original meaning is to hit and beat. "Said Wen": "Push, endure. From the hand, the sound." Such as "Shang Shu. "Pangeng 1": "If the fire is scorched in the pristine, it can't be squeezed, it can still be extinguished." "Huainanzi. "Speaking Forest": "The shady and ominous wood is struck by thunder and lightning." Gao Luu's note: "Push, strike."

" Push " means slap. For example, Du Mu in the Tang Dynasty "Autumn Festival": "Silver alone autumn light cold painting screen, Qing Luo small fan fluttering with fireflies." Northern Song Dynasty Huang Tingjian "Linhe Daozhong": "The house is full of jujubes, playing and fighting for clothes." Wipe, gently wipe. For example, in the Tang Dynasty, Du Fu's "Baidi City Ships Out of Qutang Gorge from the Baidi City in the Spring of the 3rd Year of the Dali": "The stone moss is covered with a few sticks, and the empty green is on the skin."

"Push" means to rush forward and punch down. For example, "Water Margin" Chapter 23: "Wu Song saw the big worm pounce, only flashing behind the big worm." "Journey to the West" Chapter 12: "I saw the Yuying Palace Lord, under the shade of flowers, stepping green moss However, he was full of arms by a ghost, pushed him to the ground, and captured his soul alive, but pushed Cuilian's soul into Yuying's body.

" Fluttering " also refers to smoke or odors that directly hit human senses. For example, the Tang Dynasty Phellodendron amurense "Ode to the Enlightenment of the Shangtang": "Without a bit of cold, how can plum blossoms smell fragrant." Liu Ji of the Ming Dynasty "Says from the man who sells oranges": "You can get one from the trade, cut it, if there is smoke Nose, if you look at it, it's dry."

Inscriptions in the old scribe from " Pu " from " Ge " and from the " factory " from the " Pu " glyph, reading more than ever to " flutter ", according to Liu Zhao Guodian Jane read as " police ", " shallow "" steal "glyph, glyphs when considered Bronze Interpretation change to" practice "or" scissors ", it can be said that from.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " to the sound of "菐". The original meaning is to hit and beat.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「菐」聲。本義是擊、打。《說文》：「撲，挨也。从手，菐聲。」如《尚書．盤庚上》：「若火之燎于原，不可向邇，其猶可撲滅。」《淮南子．說林》：「蔭不祥之木，為雷電所撲。」高誘注：「撲，擊也。」

　　「撲」表示拍打。如唐代杜牧〈秋夕〉：「銀獨秋光冷畫屏，輕羅小扇撲流螢。」北宋黄庭堅〈臨河道中〉：「屋頭撲棗爛盈㪷，嬉戲歡爭挽衣裳。」又表示拂拭、輕輕擦過。如唐代杜甫〈大曆三年春白帝城放船出瞿塘峽〉：「石苔凌几杖，空翠撲肌膚。」

　　「撲」表示向前猛衝、向下衝壓。如《水滸全傳》第23回：「武松見大虫 撲 來，只一閃，閃在大虫背後。」《西遊記》第12回：「只見那玉英宮主，正在花陰下，徐步綠苔而行，被鬼使撲個滿懷，推倒在地，活捉了他魂；卻將翠蓮的魂靈，推入玉英身內。」

　　「撲」亦指煙或氣味等直衝人的感官。如唐代黃檗〈上堂開示頌〉：「不經一番寒徹骨，怎得梅花撲鼻香。」明代劉基〈賣柑者言〉：「予貿得其一，剖之，如有煙撲口鼻，視其中，則干若敗絮。」

　　金文中舊有隸定為從「菐」從「戈」以及從「厂」從「菐」的字形，以往多讀為「撲」，劉釗根據郭店簡中讀為「察」、「淺」、「竊」的字形，認為金文的字形當改釋讀為「踐」或「翦」，其說可從。

撲 (Simplified: 扑)
Pinyin: pū
English Definition: to throw oneself at; to pounce on; to devote one's energies; to flap; to flutter; to dab; to pat; to bend over
Total strokes: 15; Radical: 手
Pictophonetic: 菐 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 菐 [ pú ] thicket
Example Words:
撲滅 [ pū miè ]: to eradicate; to extinguish
撲通 [ pū tōng ]: (onom.) sound of object falling into water; plop
撲救 [ pū jiù ]: firefighting; to extinguish a fire and save life and property; to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
撲克 [ pū kè ]: poker (game) (loanword); playing cards
撲鼻 [ pū bí ]: to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)

    • 菐 [ pú ] thicket
①輕打，拍：撲粉。撲蠅。撲打。
②擊拂的用具：粉撲。
③衝：撲滅。撲救。
④相搏擊：相撲。撲跌。
⑤跌倒：撲地。
⑥伏：撲在桌上看書。
⑦杖，戒尺，亦爲中國周代九刑之一。

相撲(すもう): sumo wrestling

從「 手 」，「 菐 」聲。本義是擊、打。《說文》：「撲，挨也。从手，菐聲。」如《尚書．盤庚上》：「若火之燎于原，不可向邇，其猶可撲滅。」《淮南子．說林》：「蔭不祥之木，為雷電所撲。」高誘注：「撲，擊也。」 「 撲 」表示拍打。如唐代杜牧〈秋夕〉：「銀獨秋光冷畫屏，輕羅小扇撲流螢。」北宋黄庭堅〈臨河道中〉：「屋頭撲棗爛盈㪷，嬉戲歡爭挽衣裳。」又表示拂拭、輕輕擦過。如唐代杜甫〈大曆三年春白帝城放船出瞿塘峽〉：「石苔凌几杖，空翠撲肌膚。」 「 撲 」表示向前猛衝、向下衝壓。如《水滸全傳》第23回：「武松見大虫 撲 來，只一閃，閃在大虫背後。」《西遊記》第12回：「只見那玉英宮主，正在花陰下，徐步綠苔而行，被鬼使撲個滿懷，推倒在地，活捉了他魂；卻將翠蓮的魂靈，推入玉英身內。」 「 撲 」亦指煙或氣味等直衝人的感官。如唐代黃檗〈上堂開示頌〉：「不經一番寒徹骨，怎得梅花撲鼻香。」明代劉基〈賣柑者言〉：「予貿得其一，剖之，如有煙撲口鼻，視其中，則干若敗絮。」 金文中舊有隸定為從「 菐 」從「 戈 」以及從「 厂 」從「 菐 」的字形，以往多讀為「 撲 」，劉釗根據郭店簡中讀為「 察 」、「 淺 」、「 竊 」的字形，認為金文的字形當改釋讀為「 踐 」或「 翦 」，其說可從。

撲字的基本解释

撲
pū
见“扑”。

撲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pū］
［《廣韻》普木切，入屋，滂。］
［《廣韻》蒲角切，入覺，並。］
亦作“擈1”。“扑1”的繁体字。
(1)击；打。
(2)指扑灭。
(3)拍打；拍击。
(4)拂拭；轻轻地擦。
(5)指拂拭的用具。
(6)摔；掷。
(7)向前猛冲；全身伏向。
(8)谓趴，伏。
(9)谓全心寄托。
(10)相扑。
(11)倾覆；倒下。
(12)指气味声色之类直逼（人的感官）。
(13)满，遍。
(14)棰杖。
(15)古代一种制茶的工具。
(16)围棋术语。投。
(17)古代博戏名。盛行于宋元民间，以钱为博具，掷地视字幕决胜败。
(18)宋元的一种包税制度。
(19)象声词。参见“撲哧”、“撲通”。
(20)见“撲曲”。
(21)见“撲唐唐”。
[②]［bǔ］
［《集韻》博木切，入屋，幫。］
见“撲2挑”。

撲字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　撲； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页457第02
【唐韻】蒲角切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】弼角切，?音雹。【說文】挨也。【廣韻】相撲也。　又【增韻】踣也。【韓愈·納涼聮句】朽杌惧傾撲。或作?。　又【集韻】匹角切，音璞。與㩧同。擊也。　又【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】普木切【正韻】普卜切，?與攴同。小擊也。【書·盤庚】若火之燎于原，不可嚮邇，其猶可撲滅。　又杖也。與扑同。【荀悅申鑒】桎梏鞭撲，以加小人。　又【荀子·臣道篇】若馭撲馬。【註】未調習之馬。　又【集韻】博木切，音卜。拭也。

撲字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
撲字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pū］
["Guang Yun" Pu Mu cut, enter the house, puff. ]
["Guangyun" Pujiao cuts, enters the senses, and merges. ]
Also known as "擈1". The traditional characters of "扑1".
(1) Hit; hit.
(2) Refers to extinguishing.
(3) Slap; slap.
(4) Wipe; wipe gently.
(5) Refers to wiping utensils.
(6) Throw; throw.
(7) Charge forward; all over.
(8) It is called lying down.
(9) Said that wholehearted sustenance.
(10) Sumo.
(11) Overturned; fell down.
(12) Refers to the scent, sensuality, and the like (human senses).
(13) Full, over and over.
(14) Chuzhang.
(15) An ancient tea-making tool.
(16) Go terms. cast.
(17) Ancient gambling name. Popular among the people of Song and Yuan dynasties, they used money as a tool to decide victory or defeat by watching the subtitles.
(18) A tax package system of Song and Yuan dynasties.
(19) Onomatopoeia. See "Pump", "Pump".
(20) See "Flutter".
(21) See "Pushing Tang Tang".
[②] [bǔ]
["Jiyun" Bo Muqie, enter the house, help. ]

Name meaning

pū
вм. 扑
Radicals: 扌, 業  (fingers, business)
Meaning Mnemonic
Put your fingers in somebody's business by slapping them! This method also works if someone is getting too involved in your business. Slaps are basically your way of doing business with your fingers.
Imagine giving someone a good, hard slap in the face. You're all up in their business now.
Reading Mnemonic
ぼく is one way to say "I" in Japanese, usually used by dudes. But you're going to use it now when you slap this guy. Who's in everybody's business, slapping them? ぼく.
Say that out loud, using ぼく. You're the boss, the boss of slap business.
